title: alpha
htmlContent:
If you want to apply alpha validation on the generated formControl of your dynamic form, then you just need to mention "alpha": true in the validators section of the serverData. You can configure it by allowing whitespace and adding custom message. Alpha validation can also be applied based on some condition which can be done through conditionalExpression property of alpha validation.

Dynamic Alpha Validation Scenario

Suppose you want to generate an AddressInfo form, which contains fields like CountryName, CountryCode, StateName, StateCode and you want to apply dynamic alpha validation based on server rules. Here depending upon the requirement these scenarios may arise.

  1. Allow only alphabets in CountryName without space.
  2. Allowing WhiteSpace in StateName.
  3. Apply dynamic alpha validation based on matched condition in the form, like if the CountryName is 'India' then only the cityName value should be in alphabets
  4. Adding Custom Message on StateCode Field.
  5. Shows the custom message on City Code field by using messageKey property.

Let's see how dynamic alpha validation fulfil the need.
